title: Is Riot seriously going to just leave the ARAM bug alone?
body: I've been playing a ton of ARAM recently and I'm sure you all know that dashes are currently bugged. Instead of the animation moving towards the target, it plays over in the opposite direction. I've been waiting for Riot to disable the gamemode already because it makes everything extremely confusing and annoying to play. Just a few games ago, there was a Warwick on the enemy team whose Q's launched him backwards--roughly 800 units--but the hitbox was still on the target. This literally made him invisible until the game caught up and made him nearly impossible to play against. Just imagine getting feared/ulted by an invisible unit all game, every fight with no counter-play other than to predict his movements or panic-flash. Actually ridiculous how long this bug has been going on.

replies.body:
I'm not on the teams, but I know there were a number of people investigating this on Thursday/Friday. I don't personally know when it's getting fixed, but I'm assuming there's something in testing. I'll message the teams and try to remember to followup here too.

UPDATE: So talking to folks it seems that there hasn't been a good resolution found for the bug yet, though investigation is going to continue. Around the discussion around disabling snowball, the current decision by the team that owns ARAM has been to leave it enabled given that a number of champs actually rely on it to be playable for the mode. It's a bit of a rock and a hard place, disabling it makes sense from one perspective (it's the bug that everyone can abuse if they take snowball), but disabling it is actually a pretty huge detriment to the rest of the champions on the mode. Ideally we're able to find a fix asap and deploy it - sorry that's all the info I have atm
These sorts of replies are much appreciated.

>the current decision by the team that owns ARAM has been to leave it enabled given that a number of champs actually rely on it to be playable for the mode.

Excuse me, but that's an outright false statement from them.

I won't play the "Balance" card here (as it is ARAM after all), but as one with 8240 ARAM matches, I can safely say that Mark/Dash is not vital to any champion to perform. Riven? Volibear? Singed? Warwick? Jarvan IV? Trundle? Play passive, tank up, outscale - and win.

The old Guardian's Horn's active more than made up for any need of a Summoner Spell gap closer, trust me.
Combined with Quicksilver Sash and/or Zephyr (for overkill) plus any necessity items of choice (Spirit Visage/Hydra/Cleaver etc.), that was all I ever needed to get close, do damage, and get out - alive!
Except most Rioters and ARAM players disagree with you, so....

Would be boring if everyone agreed on everything. :)

If they don't know how to play with anything else, I can understand it. I played ARAM long before Mark/Dash was invented, and I never missed something like that.

Which is why I refuse to use that ability on anyone. Ignite + Flash, even on Soraka, all day, every day.

I'm sure you know this, but Dash gives anyone a free untargetability. If timed correctly, that simple ability will dodge spells like: Ezreal's ult, Caitlyn's ult, Veigar,'s ult, Lux's ult - and I could go on. Let me put it this way: I don't like cheating. In singleplayer games, sure (console codes, .cfg commands, ASCII and HEX editing), but not here.

And a Dash with:

* True Damage.
* Vision and true vision (it does reveal stealthed champs).
* Granting an engage and escape ability.
* Non-cancel "bait" (against champs with a lock-on ability - Maokai, Vi, Thresh etc.)
* Untargetability.
* ...with the recent bug, invisibility.

...is just too much hax for me.

not saying everyone has to agree, but you can hardly make a case for your argument when most people and data points the other direction.  sorry you don't like it, but you can't present your personal anecdotes as some empirical evidence that a well-received addition to the game is somehow ruining it. that's what you don't seem to understand. you're pushing the idea that your personal experiences and beliefs should alter the game for everyone... the real kicker is the actual data completely negates anything you are saying.
For teams that get shafted with ***z e r o*** engage, or a full melee team put up against a full ranged team, snowball is quite needed

You win some, you lose some - that's the ARAM way.

>ARAM matches:	
8240	Total
4184	Wins
4056	Defeats

Some games are lost from the get-go, sure, but then you get on the other end of the scale, and no one complains then.
I don't mind either way - I'm playing ARAM for the fun. The winning is just a bonus. And Mark/Dash doesn't make it fun at all for me, with the way it's so overloaded.

I have played Jarvan IV, Riven, Vayne and some other melees into compositions like Ziggs, Lux and Jayce (this was long before Mark/Dash existed), and guess what? We won.

We bided our time for 15, long minutes, before we had scaled sufficiently, and steamrolled them in the following 7 minutes. And we had won with better tactical skills - not with some fancy dash anyone can use. And we felt really good about it.
